```{=latex}
\begin{multicols}{4}

\begin{center}
\includegraphics[width=1.2in]{../../man/figures/logo.png}

\textbf{\LARGE putior}

\textit{PUT + Input + Output + R}
\end{center}

\vspace{0.15cm}

Extract beautiful workflow diagrams from your code annotations. Works with R, Python, SQL, Shell, Julia, JavaScript, Go, Rust, and 20+ more languages.

\vspace{0.1cm}
\textcolor{divider}{\hrulefill}
\vspace{0.1cm}

\section*{\textcolor{putiorblue}{Quick Start}}

\begin{shaded}
\begin{verbatim}
# 1. Add annotation to your code
# put label:"Load Data",
      output:"clean.csv"

# 2. Generate diagram
library(putior)
put_diagram(put("./"))
\end{verbatim}
\end{shaded}

\section*{\textcolor{putiorblue}{Annotation Syntax}}

\subsection*{Basic Format}

\begin{shaded}
\begin{verbatim}
# put key:"value", key:"value"
\end{verbatim}
\end{shaded}

\subsection*{Minimal (label only)}

\begin{shaded}
\begin{verbatim}
# put label:"My Step"
\end{verbatim}
\end{shaded}

\textit{ID auto-generated, type = "process"}

\subsection*{Full Annotation}

\begin{shaded}
\begin{verbatim}
# put id:"step1", \
      label:"Load Data", \
      node_type:"input", \
      input:"config.json", \
      output:"data.csv"
\end{verbatim}
\end{shaded}

\subsection*{Alternative Formats}

\begin{shaded}
\begin{verbatim}
# put label:"Step"  # With space
#put label:"Step"   # No space
#put| label:"Step"  # Pipe
#put: label:"Step"  # Colon
\end{verbatim}
\end{shaded}

\vspace{0.1cm}
\textcolor{divider}{\hrulefill}
\vspace{0.1cm}

\section*{\textcolor{putiorpurple}{Node Types \& Shapes}}

\rowcolors{2}{tablealt}{white}
\begin{tabular}{|l|l|l|}
\hline
\rowcolor{tablebg}
\textbf{Type} & \textbf{Shape} & \textbf{Use For} \\
\hline
input & \texttt{([ ])} & Data sources \\
process & \texttt{[ ]} & Transforms \\
output & \texttt{[[ ]]} & Reports \\
decision & \texttt{\{ \}} & Branching \\
start & \texttt{([orange])} & Entry \\
end & \texttt{([green])} & Exit \\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{0.15cm}

\subsection*{Annotation Fields}

\rowcolors{2}{tablealt}{white}
\begin{tabular}{|l|l|l|}
\hline
\rowcolor{tablebg}
\textbf{Field} & \textbf{Req?} & \textbf{Default} \\
\hline
id & No & Auto UUID \\
label & Rec. & None \\
node\_type & No & "process" \\
input & No & None \\
output & No & File name \\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{0.15cm}

\subsection*{File Artifacts}

\begin{shaded}
\begin{verbatim}
# Multiple files
output:"data.csv, log.txt"

# Variable tracking
output:"result.internal"
\end{verbatim}
\end{shaded}

\textit{.internal = in-memory only}

\subsection*{Connecting Scripts}

\begin{shaded}
\begin{verbatim}
# Script A outputs file
# put label:"Fetch",
      output:"data.csv"

# Script B reads that file
# put label:"Process",
      input:"data.csv"
\end{verbatim}
\end{shaded}

\vspace{0.1cm}
\textcolor{divider}{\hrulefill}
\vspace{0.1cm}

\section*{\textcolor{putiorgreen}{Key Functions}}

\subsection*{Core Workflow}

\begin{shaded}
\begin{verbatim}
# Extract annotations
workflow <- put("./src/")
workflow <- put("script.R")
workflow <- put("./",
                recursive = TRUE)

# Generate diagram
put_diagram(workflow)
put_diagram(workflow,
            theme = "github")
\end{verbatim}
\end{shaded}

\subsection*{Auto-Annotation}

\begin{shaded}
\begin{verbatim}
# Auto-detect from code
put_auto("./src/")

# Generate annotation text
put_generate("./src/")
put_generate("./src/",
  output = "clipboard")

# Merge manual + auto
put_merge("./src/",
  merge_strategy = "supplement")
\end{verbatim}
\end{shaded}

\subsection*{Output Options}

\begin{shaded}
\begin{verbatim}
# Console (default)
put_diagram(wf)

# Copy to clipboard
put_diagram(wf,
  output = "clipboard")

# Save to file
put_diagram(wf,
  output = "file",
  file = "diagram.md")
\end{verbatim}
\end{shaded}

\subsection*{Interactive Features}

\begin{shaded}
\begin{verbatim}
# Show source file info
put_diagram(wf,
  show_source_info = TRUE)

# Clickable nodes (VS Code)
put_diagram(wf,
  enable_clicks = TRUE,
  click_protocol = "vscode")
\end{verbatim}
\end{shaded}

\vspace{0.1cm}
\textcolor{divider}{\hrulefill}
\vspace{0.1cm}

\section*{\textcolor{putiororange}{Diagram Options}}

\subsection*{Themes (9 available)}

\textbf{Standard:} \texttt{light} | \texttt{dark} | \texttt{auto} | \texttt{github} | \texttt{minimal}

\vspace{0.08cm}
\textbf{Colorblind-safe:} \texttt{viridis} | \texttt{magma} | \texttt{plasma} | \texttt{cividis}

\begin{shaded}
\begin{verbatim}
put_diagram(wf, theme="github")
put_diagram(wf, theme="viridis")
\end{verbatim}
\end{shaded}

\subsection*{Directions}

\texttt{TD} (top-down) | \texttt{LR} (left-right)

\texttt{BT} (bottom-top) | \texttt{RL} (right-left)

\begin{shaded}
\begin{verbatim}
put_diagram(wf, direction="LR")
\end{verbatim}
\end{shaded}

\subsection*{Visualization Modes}

\begin{shaded}
\begin{verbatim}
# Simple (script connections)
put_diagram(wf)

# With data artifacts
put_diagram(wf,
  show_artifacts = TRUE)

# With file labels on edges
put_diagram(wf,
  show_files = TRUE)
\end{verbatim}
\end{shaded}

\vspace{0.08cm}
\textit{Also:} \texttt{show\_workflow\_boundaries}

\end{multicols}

\subsection*{\textcolor{putiorpurple}{Branching \& Merging}}

\noindent
\begin{minipage}[t]{0.5\columnwidth}
\begin{shaded}
\begin{verbatim}
# 01_fetch_sales.R
# put label:"Fetch Sales",
      node_type:"input",
      output:"sales.csv"

# 02_fetch_customers.R
# put label:"Fetch Customers",
      node_type:"input",
      output:"customers.csv"

# 03_merge.R
# put label:"Merge Datasets",
      input:"sales.csv, customers.csv",
      output:"merged.csv"

# 04_analyze.py
# put label:"Analyze",
      input:"merged.csv",
      output:"stats.json"

# 05_report.R
# put label:"Report",
      node_type:"output",
      input:"stats.json"
\end{verbatim}

\begin{verbatim}

      node_type:"start",
      output:"config.json"

# check.R
# put label:"Validate Data?",
      node_type:"decision",
      input:"config.json"

# path_a.R
# put label:"Full Analysis",
      input:"config.json",
      output:"full.csv"

# path_b.R
# put label:"Quick Summary",
      input:"config.json",
      output:"summary.csv"
```
